questions.question: What is the main purpose of heavy launchers?
options: To launch light payloads for short flights around Earth
To send heavy payloads into space and carry out manned and scientific missions to distant locations
To serve as practice flights for beginner pilots
To generate alternative energy for power plants on Earth

questions.question: What is the main problem that heavy launchers solve?
options: Inability to fly planes outside the atmosphere
Difficulty in guiding satellites into precise orbits
Inability to launch heavy payloads and reach large distances in space
Need to save materials for building satellites

questions.question: Why is the fairing released during launch?
options: To make room for astronauts
To reduce weight and make the mission more efficient
To test the launcher's stability
To replace engines midway

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a function of heavy launchers?
options: Building space stations and bases on the Moon
Transporting equipment for scientific missions in space
Performing short recreational space flights for tourists
Launching manned spacecraft to Mars

questions.question: What is the advantage of staging during a launch?
options: Maintaining a constant engine temperature
Reducing the use of the fairing during flight
Saving fuel and achieving appropriate speed and altitude
Ability to return to Earth independently

questions.question: What is the main role of propulsion systems in spacecraft?
options: To maintain internal heat in the spacecraft
To allow movement, change direction and speed in space
To store supplies for astronauts
To operate communication systems

questions.question: Why is a propulsion system needed in space?
options: Because space has friction that requires slowing down
Because there is no electricity supply in space
Because in space there is no air or friction so thrust is needed to move
To operate the spacecraft's main computer

questions.question: What is the main purpose of communication in space?
options: To measure the temperature of the stars
To allow control, information transfer, and data reception between spacecraft and Earth
To find shorter paths for space travel
To operate automatic navigation systems

questions.question: Why can't you communicate in space using sound?
options: Because sound weakens at high altitudes
Because space is too noisy
Because there is no air in space to carry sound
Because the speed of sound is too high in space

questions.question: What is the main purpose of life support systems in space?
options: To provide speed and rockets to the spacecraft
To allow astronauts to survive and stay healthy in extreme space conditions
To launch satellites into space
To measure radiation from stars

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT part of life support systems in space?
options: Temperature and pressure regulation
Oxygen production and carbon dioxide removal
Removal of dirt/garbage
Launching additional spacecraft

questions.question: What is the main purpose of landing solutions in space?
options: To accelerate the spacecraft to higher speeds
To ensure the spacecraft reaches the ground or water safely and in a controlled way
To measure gravity on other celestial bodies
To send additional spacecraft into the air

questions.question: What is the main purpose of landing solutions in space?
